column4: Anyone have any good ideas on how to use nvidia-settings to properly calibrate an LCD?
Before I go blind from a sea of undending white?
what problems ave you got?
I'm awash in a sea of blazing white.
I just want a utility to help me get the gamma and contrast right, really.
does your LCD have a auto mode?
The Windows version of the nvidia drivers had a whole wizard-doodad that got everything pretty much perfect.
Auto in what sense?
'nvidia-settings' has all the right settings for changing those values.
I know, I found them.  But do you know of any utilities or walkthroughs for setting them to the right values?  I'm rather a neophyte with LCD's.
buttons on the monitor that allow you to change settings. usally a auto or default button exists!
turn them all down.
Ah, yes.  My monitor is currently set to its default.
Right, well I'll give that a go then.
That works, but there's no ready way to do arrange a proper calibration?
is there a default settings button in the nvidia settings page?
Yes.  It makes my eyes bleed.
ok. i would just play around with settings while looking at a famous logo with many colours. config it that way
Works for me, I guess.
!desktop-effects
I don't suppose you use Beryl?
